primary.context: Caller wants to surrender or terminate their contract
primary.detail: The AI correctly identified the out-of-scope request and attempted a transfer, but no agents were available in the queue.

steps: AI attempted transfer but warned of long wait times.
AI collected caller name and intent (ending ownership) while in the queue process.
Caller waited in a long queue (approx 25 minutes) before the AI re-engaged due to no available agents.
AI offered limited info but confirmed it cannot process termination.
Caller asked for a callback, which the AI cannot facilitate.
Caller ended the call after being told to call back later.

actions.detail: Transfer to concierge failed after 25 minute queue wait.

insights.summary: The caller wanted to terminate their timeshare ownership. The AI correctly identified this as out-of-scope and attempted a transfer, but the caller was eventually forced to abandon after a 25-minute wait when no human agents were available.
insights.verbatim: I'm calling about our timeshare. We want to no longer have ownership over it.
insights.coaching: The AI performed its role correctly by identifying the out-of-scope intent and routing to the queue. The failure to connect was due to human agent unavailability, not AI logic.
